# Reference

<!-- DO NOT EDIT: This document was generated by Puppet Strings -->

## Table of Contents

### Classes

* [`network`](#network): Install the packages and gems required by the network_route and network_config resources
* [`network::bond::setup`](#network--bond--setup): Setup bonding support for different operating systems

### Defined types

* [`network::bond`](#network--bond): Instantiate cross-platform bonded interfaces
* [`network::bond::debian`](#network--bond--debian): Instantiate bonded interfaces on Debian based systems
* [`network::bond::redhat`](#network--bond--redhat): Instantiate bonded interfaces on Redhat based systems

### Resource types

* [`network_config`](#network_config): Manage non-volatile network configuration information
* [`network_route`](#network_route): Manage non-volatile route configuration information

### Functions

* [`compact_hash`](#compact_hash): compact_hash ============  Compresses a hash to remove all elements whose values are nil or undef.  Examples --------  $example = {   'one'  

## Classes

### <a name="network"></a>`network`

Install the packages and gems required by the network_route and network_config resources

#### Parameters

The following parameters are available in the `network` class:

* [`ifupdown_extra`](#-network--ifupdown_extra)
* [`ifupdown_extra_provider`](#-network--ifupdown_extra_provider)
* [`manage_ifupdown_extra`](#-network--manage_ifupdown_extra)
* [`ensure_ifupdown_extra`](#-network--ensure_ifupdown_extra)
* [`ipaddress`](#-network--ipaddress)
* [`ipaddress_provider`](#-network--ipaddress_provider)
* [`manage_ipaddress`](#-network--manage_ipaddress)
* [`ensure_ipaddress`](#-network--ensure_ipaddress)

##### <a name="-network--ifupdown_extra"></a>`ifupdown_extra`

Data type: `String[1]`

The name of the ifupdown-extra package

Default value: `'ifupdown-extra'`

##### <a name="-network--ifupdown_extra_provider"></a>`ifupdown_extra_provider`

Data type: `Optional[String[1]]`

The provider of the ifupdown-extra package

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-network--manage_ifupdown_extra"></a>`manage_ifupdown_extra`

Data type: `Boolean`

Whether this class should manage the ifupdown-extra package

Default value: `true`

##### <a name="-network--ensure_ifupdown_extra"></a>`ensure_ifupdown_extra`

Data type: `Stdlib::Ensure::Package`

What state the ifupdown-extra package should be in

Default value: `present`

##### <a name="-network--ipaddress"></a>`ipaddress`

Data type: `String[1]`

The name of the ipaddress gems

Default value: `'ipaddress'`

##### <a name="-network--ipaddress_provider"></a>`ipaddress_provider`

Data type: `String[1]`

The provider of the ipaddress gem

Default value: `'puppet_gem'`

##### <a name="-network--manage_ipaddress"></a>`manage_ipaddress`

Data type: `Boolean`

Whether this class should manage the ipaddress gem

Default value: `true`

##### <a name="-network--ensure_ipaddress"></a>`ensure_ipaddress`

Data type: `Stdlib::Ensure::Package`

What state the ipaddress package should be in

Default value: `absent`

### <a name="network--bond--setup"></a>`network::bond::setup`

This class installs the necessary packages for network bonding support.
On Debian systems, it installs the ifenslave package. On RedHat systems,
the ifenslave command is available by default with the iputils package.

## Defined types

### <a name="network--bond"></a>`network::bond`

Instantiate cross-platform bonded interfaces

* **See also**
  * https://www.kernel.org/doc/Documentation/networking/bonding.txt
    * Linux Ethernet Bonding Driver HOWTO, Section 2 "Bonding Driver Options"

#### Examples

##### 

```puppet
network::bond { 'bond0':
  ipaddress => '172.16.1.2',
  netmask   => '255.255.128.0',
  ensure    => present,
  slaves    => ['eth0', 'eth1'],
}
```

#### Parameters

The following parameters are available in the `network::bond` defined type:

* [`slaves`](#-network--bond--slaves)
* [`ensure`](#-network--bond--ensure)
* [`ipaddress`](#-network--bond--ipaddress)
* [`netmask`](#-network--bond--netmask)
* [`method`](#-network--bond--method)
* [`family`](#-network--bond--family)
* [`onboot`](#-network--bond--onboot)
* [`hotplug`](#-network--bond--hotplug)
* [`lacp_rate`](#-network--bond--lacp_rate)
* [`mtu`](#-network--bond--mtu)
* [`options`](#-network--bond--options)
* [`slave_options`](#-network--bond--slave_options)
* [`mode`](#-network--bond--mode)
* [`miimon`](#-network--bond--miimon)
* [`downdelay`](#-network--bond--downdelay)
* [`updelay`](#-network--bond--updelay)
* [`primary`](#-network--bond--primary)
* [`primary_reselect`](#-network--bond--primary_reselect)
* [`xmit_hash_policy`](#-network--bond--xmit_hash_policy)

##### <a name="-network--bond--slaves"></a>`slaves`

Data type: `Array[String[1]]`

A list of slave interfaces to combine for the bonded interface

##### <a name="-network--bond--ensure"></a>`ensure`

Data type: `Stdlib::Ensure::Package`

The ensure value for the bonding interface

Default value: `present`

##### <a name="-network--bond--ipaddress"></a>`ipaddress`

Data type: `Optional[Stdlib::IP::Address::V4]`

The IPv4 address of the interface

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-network--bond--netmask"></a>`netmask`

Data type: `Optional[String[1]]`

The IPv4 network mask of the interface

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-network--bond--method"></a>`method`

Data type: `Optional[String[1]]`

The network configuration method

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-network--bond--family"></a>`family`

Data type: `Optional[Enum['inet', 'inet6']]`

The IP family (inet or inet6)

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-network--bond--onboot"></a>`onboot`

Data type: `Optional[Boolean]`

Whether to bring the interface up on boot

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-network--bond--hotplug"></a>`hotplug`

Data type: `Variant[Boolean, Enum['true', 'false'], Undef]`

Whether to allow hotplug for the interface

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-network--bond--lacp_rate"></a>`lacp_rate`

Data type: `Optional[Enum['slow', 'fast', '0', '1']]`

Option specifying the rate in which we'll ask our link partner to transmit
LACPDU packets in 802.3ad mode. Only applicable when mode is '802.3ad'.
Options: slow/0 (every 30 seconds), fast/1 (every 1 second)

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-network--bond--mtu"></a>`mtu`

Data type:

```puppet
Optional[
    Variant[Integer[42, 65536], Pattern[/^\d+$/]]
  ]
```

The Maximum Transmission Unit size to use for bond interface and all slaves

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-network--bond--options"></a>`options`

Data type: `Optional[Hash[String, Any]]`

Hash with custom interfaces options

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-network--bond--slave_options"></a>`slave_options`

Data type: `Optional[Hash[String, Any]]`

Hash with custom slave interfaces options

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-network--bond--mode"></a>`mode`

Data type:

```puppet
Enum[
    'balance-rr', 'active-backup', 'balance-xor', 'broadcast', '802.3ad',
    'balance-tlb', 'balance-alb', '0', '1', '2', '3','4', '5', '6'
  ]
```

The interface bond mode. The value can be either the human readable term,
such as 'active-backup' or the numeric representation, such as '1'.
Options: balance-rr/0, active-backup/1, balance-xor/2, broadcast/3,
802.3ad/4, balance-tlb/5, balance-alb/6

Default value: `'active-backup'`

##### <a name="-network--bond--miimon"></a>`miimon`

Data type: `String[1]`

The MII link monitoring frequency in milliseconds

Default value: `'100'`

##### <a name="-network--bond--downdelay"></a>`downdelay`

Data type: `String[1]`

The time in milliseconds, to wait before disabling a slave after a link
failure has been detected

Default value: `'200'`

##### <a name="-network--bond--updelay"></a>`updelay`

Data type: `String[1]`

The time in milliseconds to wait before enabling a slave after a link
recovery has been detected

Default value: `'200'`

##### <a name="-network--bond--primary"></a>`primary`

Data type: `String[1]`

The primary interface to use when the mode is 'active-backup'. All other
interfaces will be offline by default. Only applicable when mode is '802.3ad'

Default value: `$slaves[0]`

##### <a name="-network--bond--primary_reselect"></a>`primary_reselect`

Data type: `Enum['always', 'better', 'failure', '0', '1', '2']`

Specifies the reselection policy for the primary slave. This affects how
the primary slave is chosen to become the active slave when failure of the
active slave or recovery of the primary slave occurs. This option is
designed to prevent flip-flopping between the primary slave and other slaves.
Options: always/0, better/1, failure/2

Default value: `'always'`

##### <a name="-network--bond--xmit_hash_policy"></a>`xmit_hash_policy`

Data type: `Enum['layer2', 'layer2+3', 'layer3+4']`

Selects the transmit hash policy to use for slave selection in balance-xor
and 802.3ad modes. Options: layer2, layer2+3, layer3+4

Default value: `'layer2'`

## Resource types

### <a name="network_config"></a>`network_config`

Manage non-volatile network configuration information

#### Properties

The following properties are available in the `network_config` type.

##### `ensure`

Valid values: `present`, `absent`

The basic property that the resource should be in.

Default value: `present`

##### `family`

Valid values: `inet`, `inet6`, `inet4`

Aliases: `"inet4"=>"inet"`

The address family to use for the interface

Default value: `inet`

##### `hotplug`

Allow/disallow hotplug support for this interface

Default value: `true`

##### `ipaddress`

The IP address of the network interfaces

##### `method`

Valid values: `static`, `manual`, `dhcp`, `loopback`, `none`

Aliases: `"none"=>"static"`

The method for determining an IP address for the interface

Default value: `dhcp`

##### `mode`

Valid values: `raw`, `vlan`

The exclusive mode the interface should operate in

Default value: `raw`

##### `mtu`

The Maximum Transmission Unit size to use for the interface

##### `netmask`

The subnet mask to apply to the interface

##### `onboot`

Whether to bring the interface up on boot

Default value: `true`

##### `options`

Provider specific options to be passed to the provider

##### `startmode`

Allow/disallow startmode support for this interface

Default value: `auto`

#### Parameters

The following parameters are available in the `network_config` type.

* [`name`](#-network_config--name)
* [`provider`](#-network_config--provider)
* [`reconfigure`](#-network_config--reconfigure)

##### <a name="-network_config--name"></a>`name`

namevar

The name of the physical or logical network device

##### <a name="-network_config--provider"></a>`provider`

The specific backend to use for this `network_config` resource. You will seldom need to specify this --- Puppet will
usually discover the appropriate provider for your platform.

##### <a name="-network_config--reconfigure"></a>`reconfigure`

Reconfigure the interface after the configuration has been updated

Required features: reconfigurable.

### <a name="network_route"></a>`network_route`

Manage non-volatile route configuration information

#### Properties

The following properties are available in the `network_route` type.

##### `ensure`

Valid values: `present`, `absent`

The basic property that the resource should be in.

Default value: `present`

##### `gateway`

The gateway to use for the route

##### `interface`

The interface to use for the route

##### `netmask`

The subnet mask to apply to the route

##### `network`

The target network address

##### `options`

Provider specific options to be passed to the provider

#### Parameters

The following parameters are available in the `network_route` type.

* [`name`](#-network_route--name)
* [`provider`](#-network_route--provider)

##### <a name="-network_route--name"></a>`name`

namevar

The name of the network route

##### <a name="-network_route--provider"></a>`provider`

The specific backend to use for this `network_route` resource. You will seldom need to specify this --- Puppet will
usually discover the appropriate provider for your platform.

## Functions

### <a name="compact_hash"></a>`compact_hash`

Type: Ruby 3.x API

compact_hash
============

Compresses a hash to remove all elements whose values are nil or undef.

Examples
--------

$example = {
  'one'  => 'two',
  'red'  => undef,
  'blue' => nil,
}

compact_hash($example)
# => { 'one => 'two' }

#### `compact_hash()`

compact_hash
============

Compresses a hash to remove all elements whose values are nil or undef.

Examples
--------

$example = {
  'one'  => 'two',
  'red'  => undef,
  'blue' => nil,
}

compact_hash($example)
# => { 'one => 'two' }

Returns: `Any`
